title.narrative: United in Building and Advancing Life Expectations (UBALE)

description.narrative: (Malawi): The southern region of Malawi is prone to droughts and floods. The frequencies and magnitudes of the droughts and floods affect food production leading to food insecurity, especially among the vulnerable households. Other factors such as environmental degradation, high population growth and lack of livelihood options exacerbates the food insecurity situation. USAID's United in Building and Advancing Life Expectations activity will invest $975,800 of FY 2019 Title II resources, in addition to Community Development Funds, to improve food security and livelihoods for 248,200 households in the disaster-prone areas of Blantyre, Chikwawa and Nsanje districts of Southern Malawi. Illustrative activities include: 1) Social behavior change around maternal and child health and nutrition, and family planning using the Care Group Model; 2) the promotion of conservation agriculture, natural resource management, agribusiness, and informal micro-finance finance among smallholders; and 3) community-based disaster risk management. These interventions will improve maternal and child health, nutrition, and livelihoods among beneficiaries, and will increase the capacity of targeted households to withstand natural and economic shocks and stresses. The activity is aligned with USAID's Feed the Future Secondary Zone of Influence and supports the Integrated Country Strategy's Mission objective 1.2 to increase sustainable livelihoods. The activity supports Goal 4.4 of the Joint Regional Strategy and Strategic Objective 1.1 of the Joint Strategic Plan..
